revised_title: Analyzing Light Caustics from Rippling Water
tldr: The authors study the formation of light caustics produced by refraction or reflection of sunlight through rippling water surfaces. They use a mathematical model to analyze the fine structure of caustic patterns and confirm their findings through experiments using a ripple tank and glass slides. The research reveals the complex interplay of light and water waves, providing insights into the formation of caustic patterns commonly observed in nature.
